intro: Claytonia pleiopetala, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, fuzzy layer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks. Claytonia pleiopetala is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
